title: Roman capital "Q"
content:
Hello all,

I’m looking for a roman capital “Q”, that would be a very light grey, and large, against a white background on a question-answer page of a website (The left part and part of the top left of the letterform would be off-screen). Black type (Helvetica Neue Cond at about 28pt) would be in the forefront as a question, with smaller supporting body copy below.

Any recommendations of an attractive non-sans “Q” that you might find particularly extraordinary?

Thanks.

Andrew

 [‹ Help! Free substitute for Bodega Sans?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083151/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19345 "Go to previous forum topic") [Ai Blend Tool and Type ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083151/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42937 "Go to next forum topic")
author: andrewh973

comments.content:
[Fling](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083151/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/fling/) from ITC. (The preview is cropping it badly. Look in the character palette below.)  
 [Kursiv Stehend Haar](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083151/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/kursiv_stehend_haar/) and/or [Kursive Stehend](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083151/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/kursiv_stehend/?sample_text=Q&sample_size=388) both from Linotype.

Modest: [Cochin (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083151/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/cochin_lt_std_bold_ot/?sample_text=Q&sample_size=388)  
Flamboyant: [Hoefler Text Black Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083151/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/hoefler-text/black-italic/mac-ttf/7115/character/0051/CP2/1/) (or, even better, [Hoefler Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083151/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100011))
